page.title: 18Warbleton-change & tradition
page.content: A survey of people in the area revealed various causes for concern and areas of change in the village. Two scrap yards at Turner's Green and not infrequent heavy lorries are casting a blight on the inherent beauty of the countryside.Insecticides have reduced the number of poppies in the cornfields and certain insects such as glow worms. Many farms and related houses have been split and sold to "suburban strangers" and are rarely bases for agriculture. One comment was that farming was often a "leisure" activity in this area rather than a chief means of livelihood. Although local dialect and accent are fading there are one or two local expressions still in common usage eg. if there are clouds in the west it is said to be "raining over Will's mothers."
